benchmark_details.name: SCIDQA
benchmark_details.overview: SCIDQA is a new dataset for reading comprehension that challenges language models for a deep understanding of scientific articles, consisting of 2,937 question-answer pairs sourced from peer reviews and answers by paper authors.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To facilitate research on complex scientific text understanding and to benchmark the performance of language models in comprehending scientific papers.

data.source: Peer reviews and author responses from scientific papers on OpenReview.
data.annotation: Manual annotation by domain experts and human revision processes.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the similarity of model-generated answers to gold standard answers.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in generating accurate and relevant responses.
methodology.validation: The dataset undergoes extensive human annotation and filtering for relevance and quality.
